pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 2 by SSCI

content.raw:
We decided to add an upward lidar on all ground vehicles that we built in order to scout out for vertical shafts or high ceilings above the ground vehicles.  This is primarily for mapping, and would be the type of information that could be relayed to flying vehicles that could scan those areas later.  We based it off of a lidarlite type of laser since they are inexpensive and easy to integrate on a real vehicle.  However, if this is the deciding point between accepting this model and not accepting it, we would gladly remove it.  

The other difference with this vehicle versus x2 config 6 is the addition of rgbd cameras that can observe the ground in front of the vehicle and the ceiling.  It is important to see the ground in order to sense small obstacles and to see the ceiling in order to see high artifacts and for mapping.  The intention was to build an alternative to config 6 that had just as much perception capability, but with much lower-cost sensors \(since velodyne 3D lidars are quite expensive but 2D lidars like the RPLidar S1 are inexpensive in comparison and lighter-weight\).
